dialogue.text: I know what I must do.
Wait! Don’t shoot!
This isn’t that kind of game!
Who are you and what are you doing in my house?
We’ve come to stop you from destroying everything you love and ultimately ushering in the start of Chapter 4.
Put the gun down, Sensei. You don’t need to do this.
Why should I trust you? I never gave you a key.
Wouldn’t it be fair to assume that we just...got our hands on one the same way you just got your hands on like fifty of them?
I don’t know what you’re talking about. But I’m going to give you ten seconds to get out of my house before I open fire.
Sensei! Wait!
Ami?
Okay, you can shoot now. I just wanted to make sure I had a front row seat.
Hey! How come you remember Ami but not us? We’re just as important to the story as she is!
Ami, who are these people?
Ayane and Maya. They’re your arch-nemeses and your current mission is to eliminate them by any means possible.
Ami, you traitor!
We’re in for a long day, aren’t we?
Wait a second. If you’re Ami, why are you covered in mosaics?
I’m not! You’re just imagining that I am!
Eep!
I can’t trust any of you.
{i}Aaaaah! I’m getting out of here!{/i}
Sensei! Stop shooting! You don’t understand what-
Aaah!
{i}Okay. I’m out.{/i}
Maya, wait! We’re supposed to stick together!
So it really {i}is{/i} dangerous outside.
I shouldn’t have opened the door.
I manage to make it to the city streets with my life still intact, but I know that everyone is against me now. And I will stop at nothing to ensure my safety.
Oh, Sensei. Have you calmed down yet?
That was crazy, right? It really felt like you were trying to shoot me back there.
Something still seems off about you...
Again, you’re probably just imagining it. But that doesn’t matter right now. What {i}does{/i} matter is giving you a quick mission briefing so we can get you to the roof on time!
You escaped the safety room, so that’s where you’re headed next, right?
I’m headed nowhere in particular. I just want to enjoy my freedom.
Well, if you’re looking for suggestions on {i}how{/i} to enjoy that freedom, why not pay the rest of the girls a visit?
You’ve been gone for a really long time and we’ve all been waiting for you to come back, so I took the liberty of putting together a kind of...card! Of sorts.
A card?
Yeah. I had everybody come up with a list of the things they like most about you because I thought hearing it would make you happy.
The thing is, though, not everybody has processed your disappearance as well as I have. So most of them are broken now.
Broken how?
Well, basically, they think they’re in the card. And that this city’s made of paper.
You’re trying to trick me again, aren’t you?
Of course not! I would never-
Wait. Did I say “never?” I meant-
{i}Ami Arakawa has been eliminated.{/i}
{i}Nineteen students remain.{/i}
Not for long...
Where to next?
